questions.question_text:
A manufacturing company uses advanced warehouse management functionality for a new warehouse.
After releasing a production order, you observe that the warehouse work for raw material picking was not generated.
You need to go through the warehouse management setup to determine what is missing.
What three setup configurations must you validate? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
I will go with ACE - Waves and wave management are more relevant in scenarios where there is a need to optimize the processing of multiple orders simultaneously. Since the question did not mention multiple production orders, ACE is more correct. 
On the other hand, Directive codes are essential in guiding the system on how to handle various processes within the warehouse including work generation.

Selected Answer: ACE
It's important to ensure that the work template, directive codes, and location directive are configured accurately to enable the system to generate warehouse work for raw material picking in response to the production order release..

Selected Answer: ABE
What's with Directive codes?
Answers are correct as per link provided for setup

comments.content: B is less specific than A so it repeats. The provided answer appears to be the best.

discussion.content: Correct me if I'm wrong, but I see no issue in switching the middle two items. The task is still doable and seems to be a matter of preferences in this case.

comments.content: It's all about the order of operations in Microsoft docs. The last 4 links are in the same order as the answer. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/setting-up-and-maintaining-batch-order-sequencing

discussion.content:
See link: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/set-up-sequence-groups

I created sample data for this. Sequence is: 1) Create Sequence groups, 2) Create Sequence ID's, 3) Assign Sequence ID's to Items (or Items to Sequence ID's), 4) Assign sequence group ID's to Resources and Resource Groups.

comments.content: You create the Sequence ID and the Values for the sequence first, so it appears on the Sequence Group - Sequences section and you select it. If you do first the Sequence Group, you can still do it with right click and Details, but it is not the actual correct order.
